result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikel J. Koller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for time served, if any, to be determined.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF13

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Must seek and maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education which is satisfactory to his agent, commensurate with his treatment needs.  Defendant must not leave or change employment without prior approval of his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

No contact with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF13.

ADDRESS INFO for Mikel J. Koller
Current: PO Box 2000, c/o New Lisbon Correctional, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 02-26-2016)
Prior: P.O. Box 661, C/O Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Parties have both PSI.  No changes noted.  State agrees to probation's recommendation.  15CF13:  8 yrs total. 4 years incarceration, 4 years extended supervision.  15CF157:  4 yrs total.  2 years incarceration, 2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent to each other, consecutive to sentence now serving.  Complete AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.  No contact with any known drug users or dealers.  Not to possess or consume alcohol, nor enter any establishment where alcohol is available for consumption on the premises or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Pay all Court ordered financial obligations and any other fees deemed appropriate. Cooperate with any other assessment and treatment programming deemed appropriate by the Department of  Corrections.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  Defense recommended: 4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision,  concurrent.  Or consecutive probation.  Or 4 years initial confinement, with more extended supervision.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  15CF13: 8  years total. 4  years initial confinement,  4  years extended supervision.  Consecutive to sentencing serving, concurrent to 15CF157.  

15CF157:  4 years total.   2 years initial confinement,   2  years extended supervision. Consecutive to sentence now serving.

Complete AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.
No contact with any known drug users or dealers
Not to possess or consume alcohol, nor enter any establishment where alcohol is available for consumption on the
premises or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Pay all Court ordered financial obligations and any other fees deemed appropriate.
Cooperate with any other assessment and treatment programming deemed appropriate by the Department of
Corrections.
Eligible for SAP & CIP.  DNA sample if not already provided.  DNA surcharge.   Cooperate with any other assessment and treatment programming deemed appropriate by the Department of  Corrections.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Obtain and maintain employment/school,  commensurate with his treatment needs.  Credit for time served, if any, to be determined.
February 25, 2016.
February 18, 2016 at 1:30
Sentencing hearing at 02-25-2016 01:30 pm
DA's office requested copies of PSI's
Alternate.
Sentencing hearing at 02-18-2016 01:30 pm

Waive reading of the information.  Plead to count 1 without repeater.  DRI remaining counts.  Victim notification complied with, per ADA.  Nothing returned from the vicitm.  State requesting PSI.  No agreement on sentence.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  No contest plea entered by the defendant.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given. Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Felony bail jumping.  Counts 2-7 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  PSI ordered.  Due 2/5/16.  Sentencing set for 2/18/16 at 1:30 pm.  1/2 hour block.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in court, in custody, with Attorney Bosben. Court reviewed the form with the defendant.  He stated he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intellgently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.   Information filed with the court.
Plea hearing at 12-14-2015 01:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Bosben appeared.  Defendant is currently in Dodge Correctional.  Set for plea
